question: Your company implemented BigQuery as an enterprise data warehouse. Users from multiple business units run queries on this data warehouse. However, you notice that query costs for BigQuery are very high, and you need to control costs. Which two methods should you use? (Choose two.)

A.answer: Split the users from business units to multiple projects.

B.answer: Apply a user- or project-level custom query quota for BigQuery data warehouse.

C.answer: Create separate copies of your BigQuery data warehouse for each business unit.

D.answer: Split your BigQuery data warehouse into multiple data warehouses for each business unit.

E.answer: Change your BigQuery query model from on-demand to flat rate. Apply the appropriate number of slots to each Project.

question: You are building a product on top of Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). You have a single GKE cluster. For each of your customers, a Pod is running in that cluster, and your customers can run arbitrary code inside their Pod. You want to maximize the isolation between your customers' Pods. What should you do?

A.answer: Use Binary Authorization and whitelist only the container images used by your customers' Pods.

B.answer: Use the Container Analysis API to detect vulnerabilities in the containers used by your customers' Pods.

C.answer: Create a GKE node pool with a sandbox type configured to gvisor. Add the parameter runtimeClassName: gvisor to the specification of your customers' Pods.

D.answer: Use the cos_containerd image for your GKE nodes. Add a nodeSelector with the value cloud.google.com/gke-os-distribution: cos_containerd to the specification of your customers' Pods.

question: Your finance team wants to view the billing report for your projects. You want to make sure that the finance team does not get additional permissions to the project. What should you do?

A.answer: Add the group for the finance team to roles/billing user role.

B.answer: Add the group for the finance team to roles/billing admin role.

C.answer: Add the group for the finance team to roles/billing viewer role.

D.answer: Add the group for the finance team to roles/billing project/Manager role.

question: Your organization has strict requirements to control access to Google Cloud projects. You need to enable your Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) to approve requests from the Google Cloud support team when an SRE opens a support case. You want to follow Google-recommended practices. What should you do?

A.answer: Add your SREs to roles/iam.roleAdmin role.

B.answer: Add your SREs to roles/accessapproval.approver role.

C.answer: Add your SREs to a group and then add this group to roles/iam.roleAdmin.role.

D.answer: Add your SREs to a group and then add this group to roles/accessapproval.approver role.

question: You need to host an application on a Compute Engine instance in a project shared with other teams. You want to prevent the other teams from accidentally causing downtime on that application. Which feature should you use?

D.answer: Enable deletion protection on the instance.

question: Your organization needs to grant users access to query datasets in BigQuery but prevent them from accidentally deleting the datasets. You want a solution that follows Google-recommended practices. What should you do?

A.answer: Add users to roles/bigquery user role only, instead of roles/bigquery dataOwner.

B.answer: Add users to roles/bigquery dataEditor role only, instead of roles/bigquery dataOwner.

C.answer: Create a custom role by removing delete permissions, and add users to that role only.

D.answer: Create a custom role by removing delete permissions. Add users to the group, and then add the group to the custom role.

question: You have a developer laptop with the Cloud SDK installed on Ubuntu. The Cloud SDK was installed from the Google Cloud Ubuntu package repository. You want to test your application locally on your laptop with Cloud Datastore. What should you do?

A.answer: Export Cloud Datastore data using gcloud datastore export.

B.answer: Create a Cloud Datastore index using gcloud datastore indexes create.

C.answer: Install the google-cloud-sdk-datastore-emulator component using the apt get install command.

D.answer: Install the cloud-datastore-emulator component using the gcloud components install command.

question: Your company set up a complex organizational structure on Google Cloud. The structure includes hundreds of folders and projects. Only a few team members should be able to view the hierarchical structure. You need to assign minimum permissions to these team members, and you want to follow Google-recommended practices. What should you do?

A.answer: Add the users to roles/browser role.

B.answer: Add the users to roles/iam.roleViewer role.

C.answer: Add the users to a group, and add this group to roles/browser.

D.answer: Add the users to a group, and add this group to roles/iam.roleViewer role.

question: Your company has a single sign-on (SSO) identity provider that supports Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) integration with service providers. Your company has users in Cloud Identity. You would like users to authenticate using your company's SSO provider. What should you do?

A.answer: In Cloud Identity, set up SSO with Google as an identity provider to access custom SAML apps.

B.answer: In Cloud Identity, set up SSO with a third-party identity provider with Google as a service provider.

C.answer: Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials, configure the user consent screen, and set up OAuth 2.0 for Mobile & Desktop Apps.

D.answer: Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials, configure the user consent screen, and set up OAuth 2.0 for Web Server Applications.

question: Your organization has a dedicated person who creates and manages all service accounts for Google Cloud projects. You need to assign this person the minimum role for projects. What should you do?

A.answer: Add the user to roles/iam.roleAdmin role.

B.answer: Add the user to roles/iam.securityAdmin role.

C.answer: Add the user to roles/iam.serviceAccountUser role.

D.answer: Add the user to roles/iam.serviceAccountAdmin role.
